content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I attempted to install the 'arcgis' module using pip install arcgis, but the first attempt failed due to too much output. I then tried again using pip install arcgis with the execute_shell_popen command, which returned a subprocess PID of 4391. I received a message to execute Python code to generate a river map using the 'arcgis' module. I added the path to the 'arcgis' module and imported necessary libraries. I connected to ArcGIS Online and created a new web map. I added a feature layer to the map and saved it with the title "River Map" and a snippet "A map of rivers in the USA". I received a message to execute Python code to generate a river map using the 'arcgis' module. I added the code to add a feature layer to the map and saved it with the title "River Map" and a snippet "A map of rivers in the USA".
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_shell", "args": {"command_line": "pip install arcgis"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_shell_popen", "args": {"command_line": "pip install arcgis"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command execute_shell_popen returned: Subprocess started with PID:'4391'", type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_python_code", "args": {"code": "#!/usr/bin/env python\\n\\nimport sys\\n\\n# Add the path to the \'arcgis\' module\\nsys.path.append(\'/usr/local/lib/python3.9/site-packages\')\\n\\nfrom arcgis.gis import GIS\\nfrom arcgis.mapping import WebMap\\n\\n# Connect to ArcGIS Online\\ngis = GIS(\\"https://www.arcgis.com\\", \\"username\\", \\"password\\")\\n\\n# Create a new web map\\nweb_map = WebMap()\\n\\n# Add a feature layer to the map\\nweb_map.add_layer({\\"type\\": \\"FeatureLayer\\", \\"url\\": \\"https://services.arcgis.com/V6ZHFr6zdgNZuVG0/arcgis/rest/services/USA_Rivers_and_Streams/FeatureServer/0\\"})\\n\\n# Save the web map\\nweb_map.save(item_properties={\\"title\\": \\"River Map\\", \\"snippet\\": \\"A map of rivers in the USA\\"})", "basename": "generate_river_map"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_python_code", "args": {"code": "#!/usr/bin/env python\\n\\nimport sys\\n\\n# Add the path to the \'arcgis\' module\\nsys.path.append(\'/usr/local/lib/python3.9/site-packages\')\\n\\nfrom arcgis.gis import GIS\\nfrom arcgis.mapping import WebMap\\n\\n# Connect to ArcGIS Online\\ngis = GIS(\\"https://www.arcgis.com\\", \\"username\\", \\"password\\")\\n\\n# Create a new web map\\nweb_map = WebMap()\\n\\n# Add a feature layer to the map\\nweb_map.add_layer({\\"type\\": \\"FeatureLayer\\", \\"url\\": \\"https://services.arcgis.com/V6ZHFr6zdgNZuVG0/arcgis/rest/services/USA_Rivers_and_Streams/FeatureServer/0\\"})\\n\\n# Save the web map\\nweb_map.save(item_properties={\\"title\\": \\"River Map\\", \\"snippet\\": \\"A map of rivers in the USA\\"})", "basename": "generate_river_map"}}}', type='ai_response')]
